intro: Pimpinella brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts when mature. Pimpinella brachycarpa is generally herbaceous and can be found in temperate regions.
